subject: RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
body:
Yes, we have 30-day terms for external contractors. It’s sometimes a day or two past 30 just due to run timing, but on paper it’s 30.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 5:33 PM
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Thanks SG!
We pay translators within 30 days, correct?
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 16:01
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
HI again SG. I also found this old form (attached) that it seems we used to send to translators to get their banking info / payment preferences. Again, no rush, but can you also check if the attached is needed? Or maybe parts are needed or things need to be updated?
 
Thanks again!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 12:15 PM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Re: Onboarding info - LCW
body:
Hi again Sarah,
I'm copying our bookkeeper, SG, who will send you instructions for invoicing (via a timesheet). SG will get you all set up for payments.
@Accounting
 - Sarah's rate is $30/hr. LMK if you need more info. (I'm awaiting her W9).
Thank you!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 9:18 AM
To:
 sj93@outlook.com <sj93@outlook.com>
Subject:
 Onboarding info - LCW
 
 
Good morning, Sarah,
I'm super excited to have you start! Here's a long email with lots of info! 🙂
To get you set up, attached please find our 
Contactor Agreement 
for your signature. You just need to add your address under 9.g & fill in the "Contractor" box on the last page. You can sign electronically. LMK if you have any issues with the form.
I've also attached a 
W9
 form for you to send in case you don't have one already. Please send this back.
And I attached the
 job description
 again just to have everything in one place 🙂.
Please send your 
resume
 when you get a moment.
I got your 
LCW email
 set up. See attached image. Email is: s.jordan@lcwmail.com. Your current PW is Password: H&420715447080ud . When you log in, it will ask you to reset your password. 
Up to you, but I use office 365 online (instead of downloading the app). You can use either. LMK if you have any issues getting in.
Lastly, I will need your banking information. I will send a separate email about that & will introduce you to our bookkeeper, Sarah (they/them) - who we call SG 🙂. We will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks).
One more thing...
I'd love to chat again to explain a bunch of things about LCW
 & how we work, etc.
I have time tomorrow (Thurs) at 9am or at 4pm. Or I can do Mon from 2pm onward. LMK what works for you!
I will also put you in touch with Kaitlin so she can explain the tasks she does (Zoom stuff, scheduling, training evaluations, etc.).

subject: Notice of Time to File UI Quarterly Tax and Wage Reports
body:
Your Wisconsin Quarterly Unemployment Insurance Tax and Wage Reports and payment for first quarter 2025 are due on April 30, 2025. You can now login to your UI account at 
http://dwd.wisconsin.gov/ui
 and file the reports for first quarter 2025. If you've already filed the reports for first quarter 2025, no further action is required. 
You received this email because a user created Login ID subscribed to receive quarterly Time to File email reminders at this email address. This Time to File email reminder was not sent in reference to a specific Wisconsin Unemployment Insurance Account. 
If you no longer wish to receive this email, login to your account and update your email subscriptions. Email subscriptions are located in the "Other Functions" section of the Unemployment Insurance Online Services web site.
Please do not reply to this email. Questions or comments may be sent to 
taxnet@dwd.wisconsin.gov

subject: Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
body:
Thanks SG!
We pay translators within 30 days, correct?
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 16:01
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
HI again SG. I also found this old form (attached) that it seems we used to send to translators to get their banking info / payment preferences. Again, no rush, but can you also check if the attached is needed? Or maybe parts are needed or things need to be updated?
 
Thanks again!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 12:15 PM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile

Subject:
 Request to update ACH instructions for Language & Culture Worldwide LLC (#95173)
Importance:
 High
 
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Accounting Team at LCW   ,
 
In addition to having the form filled out with it’s accompaning supporting documenation (IE a voided check).  Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for updating ACH instructions and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps.
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
To proceed, please call 704-357-6551, you may set up a time and date first, with me through email, if you’d prefer.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández

I ran a big reconciliation on BSC prepayments yesterday, and the great news is we only have $2,500 of their prepayment on file in Scoro that I think shouldn’t be there – it seems to be from an SOW that spanned the “gap” of when ownership changed in 2022, so I don’t have good records.
